sen.j: 松田 元陸（まつだ もとみち、生年不詳 - 享禄4年6月4日 (旧暦)（1531年7月17日））は武将。
sen.e: Motomichi MATSUDA (year of birth unknown - July 17, 1531) was busho (a Japanese military commander).

sen.j: 元隆とも呼ばれる事が多いが復元された系図により元陸という名であった事が判明した。
sen.e: In many cases, he is called Mototaka, but the family tree restored shows that his name is Motomichi.

sen.j: 祖父の松田元成の戦死以降、赤松氏、浦上氏との対立が根深い松田氏であった。
sen.e: After his grandfather, Motonari MATSUDA died in battle, the Matsuda clan had deep confrontation with the Akamatsu clan and the Uragami clan.

sen.j: 永正16年(1519年)、赤松義村と対立し三井城に籠もった浦上村宗と元陸は密かに同盟した。
sen.e: In 1519, Motomichi allied secretly with Muramune URAGAMI who conflicted with Yoshimura AKAMATSU and was besieged in Mii-jo Castle.

sen.j: 村宗と義村の対立騒動では常に村宗方に味方し、村宗の赤松家中の実権掌握の一助を担う。
sen.e: He was always on Muramune side at disturbance from the confrontation between Muramune and Yoshimura, and helped Muramune get control over the Akamatsu family.

sen.j: それにより元陸の権力も強まり、大永2年(1522年)、将軍足利義晴により京都所司代に命ぜられる。
sen.e: This strengthened Motomichi's power as well, and he was appointed to Kyoto shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy) by Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, Shogun in 1522.

sen.j: 後に日蓮宗妙覚寺の別当も務めた。
sen.e: He later served as betto (administrator) of the Myokaku-ji Temple of Nichiren sect.

sen.e: He later served as betto (administrator) of the Myokaku-ji Temple of the Nichiren Sect.

sen.j: 享禄4年(1531年)、将軍足利義晴の命により大物崩れに参加、赤松晴政の裏切りで村宗や細川高国もろとも戦死した。
sen.e: In 1531, he joined Daimotsu kuzure (the Battle of Daimotsu) under the order from Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and died in the battle along with Muramune and Takakuni HOSOKAWA due to Harumasa AKAMATSU's treachery.
